title: BMW 6 Series M Sport Limited Edition officially debuts
text:
Home » Cars » BMW 6 Series M Sport Limited Edition officially debuts BMW 6 Series M Sport Limited Edition officially debuts / 0 comments 
BMW has released a special edition of the 6 Series dubbed the M Sport Limited Edition, which will be available in “restricted numbers” for all three body styles – Coupe, Convertible and Gran Coupe. 
The 6 Series M Sport Limited Edition comes with a Sonic Speed Blue metallic exterior paint finish, paired with a set of 20-inch M light alloy wheels in a Bicolour finish, as well as carbon-fibre mirror caps. 
Moving inside, the special edition 6 Series is fitted with blue door sill covers that bear the words “M Sport Limited Edition.” Additionally, the seats are trimmed with fine-grain Merino leather from BMW Individual, which follow a Black/Fjord Blue colour scheme. 
Finishing touches on the interior include floor mats that feature Fjord Blue piping for contrast, along with carbon-fibre trim on the centre console, doors, infotainment display surround, and other areas. 
The brand will begin selling the limited edition model from April 2017, and customers will be able to choose from 320 hp in-line six-cylinder petrol, 450 hp V8 petrol, or a 313 hp in-line six-cylinder diesel engines.
